page.title: 04History of Warslow Schools
page.content: Warslow Primary School used to be housed in the school building opposite the church on the main road. In 1979 the Middle School and First Schools were formed, the Middle School moving into the former Secondary School building and the First School remaining in the old building. A year later the First School joined the Middle School in their present building. In September 1983 Staffordshire Education Committee announced that they wanted to close the Middle School to save money. They suggested that the children should transfer to a Leek school, 8 miles away. An Action Group was formed and several members went to see the Minister for Education, to put forward their point of view. He decided that the school should remain open because of the long distance the children would have had to travel.
